name: MICSI
headline: Higher resolution MRI with faster scan times.
description: MICSI is introducing AI software that doubles resolution and halves scan time. This breakthrough enables imaging centers to significantly enhance their capacity and patient throughput, potentially saving countless lives and generating an additional $2 million of revenue per MRI scanner. Our initial offering serves as a stepping stone toward the company’s larger vision of transforming the MRI into a truly quantitative instrument that is capable of providing highly reproducible data for more accurate diagnoses and patient management.

founders.name: Gregory Lemberskiy, Founder
founders.description: Gregory Lemberskiy (CEO) co-founded MICSI with goal of bringing cutting edge image processing tools, that he encountered in the research setting into clinical practice. His PhD work (2019) focused on algorithm development for image enhancement and biophysical modeling of the MRI signal. His methods have been used to enable high-end quality on low field MRI systems through noise reduction (MICSI’s first product) and use MRI to characterize the physical properties of prostate glandular lumen.

founders.name: Benjamin Ades-Aron, Founder
founders.description: I got my PhD in electrical engineering in 2022 from NYU, where I specialized in developing machine learning based computer vision algorithms for the visualization of MRI data. I specialize in developing software to process and route diffusion and functional MRI data, with a goal of improving image signal, reducing noise, and producing clinically viable diagnostic imaging biomarkers.

# Higher Resolution Greater Accuracy[[1,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1053811916303949?via%3Dihub>) [2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [3]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/journals.lww.com/investigativeradiology/abstract/2023/10000/feasibility_of_accelerated_prostate.3.aspx>)
## MICSI improves MRI image quality with software
MICSI-RMT (K241121) is FDA 510(k) cleared
1.5T SIEMENS MAGNETOM AERADiffusion Weighted b=2000 images, 1.0 mm isotropic
![MRI Quality Set 1 Original](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set1-Brain-Top-Original.webp)
Original
![MRI Quality Set 1 MICSI](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set1-Brain-Top-MICSI.webp)
MP-PCA
![MRI Quality Set 2 Original](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set2-Original.webp)
Original
![play-button](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Icon.Play.svg)
![MRI Quality Set 2 MICSI](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set2-MICSI.webp)
MP-PCA
![MRI Quality Set 3 Original](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set3-Original.webp)
Original
![play-button](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Icon.Play.svg)
![MRI Quality Set 3 MICSI](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set3-MICSI.webp)
MP-PCA
![MRI Quality Set 4 Original](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set4-Tracto-Original.webp)
Original
![MRI Quality Set 4 MICSI](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Carousel/Set4-Tracto-MICSI.webp)
MP-PCA
MICSI-RMT is a software suite that enhances diffusion and functional MRI image quality.
The core of MICSI-RMT is the MP-PCA algorithm, which leverages the redundancy over MRI measurements to remove noise. MICSI-RMT also includes processing modules that support weighted linear least squares and Bayesian fitting techniques to facilitate quantitative analysis of diffusion weighted imaging. Lastly, MICSI-RMT features cutting edge DICOM data routing ensuring securing and seamless integration into medical workflows.
## Our Mission
To Make MRI
More Accessible
More Cost Effective
Supported by Clinical Research, Our Patented[[1]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.neuroimage.2016.08.016>) Denoising Method Utilizing MP-PCA Reduces Noise[[1]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1053811916303949?via%3Dihub>) & Increases Sensitivity[[4]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1007%2Fs11682-018-9941-x>) with Fewer Images[[2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [3]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1097/rli.0000000000000979>)
Reduction in Noise[[1]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1053-8119\(16\)30394-9>)
Our method demonstrated a 4-fold reduction in noise levels, without compromising the integrity of the diagnostic signal. Rigorous validation confirms that MP-PCA preserves the true anatomical structure, ensuring that the denoising process is both highly effective and remarkably safe for clinical application.[[1,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1053-8119\(16\)30394-9>) [2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [5]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-25431-8>)
[Learn More](https://www.micsi.co/</denoising#denoising-section-9>)
Increased Sensitivity with Few Images[[2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [3]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1097/rli.0000000000000979>)
MC-PCA increases the sensitivity of standard MRI protocols requiring fewer images while maintaining the diagnostic sensitivity of the original measurements.[[2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [3]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1097/rli.0000000000000979>)
[Learn More](https://www.micsi.co/</denoising#denoising-section-11>)
## Superior Image Quality to Alternative Solutions
![Quality Comparison Chart - Utilizing Hardware](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Comparision.2.svg)
![Quality Comparison Chart - Upgrade Software](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Comparision.3.svg)
![Quality Comparison Chart - Software Solutions](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Comparision.4.svg)
![Quality Comparison Chart - Utilizing Hardware](https://www.micsi.co/app/themes/micsi/assets/images/Home/Comparision.2.svg)
Advantages for Providers Benefits for Patients
## Boost MRI Image Quality[[1,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1053-8119\(16\)30394-9>) [2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [5]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-25431-8>)
### Higher Resolution MRI
Doubling voxel dimensions reduces image quality by 8x, but MP-PCA offsets this loss.[[1,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1053-8119\(16\)30394-9>) [2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [6]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/direct.mit.edu/imag/article/doi/10.1162/imag_a_00060/118691/Denoising-diffusion-MRI-Considerations-and>)
### Older Hardware
Image quality differs by roughly 2x between 1.5T and 3.0T MRI systems. MICSI-RMT bridges this gap, extending the life cycle of older MR systems.
## Fewer MRI Images Required[[2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [3]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1097/rli.0000000000000979>)
### Increase Image Throughput
Enhance efficiency with fewer images without sacrificing image quality.
### Elevating the standard of MRI
Requiring fewer images frees up the schedule for more complex, time-intensive MR sequences.
## Boost MRI Image Quality[[1,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1053-8119\(16\)30394-9>) [2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [5]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-25431-8>)
### Image Quality for All
With our technology, advanced imaging once limited to high-field MRIs is now accessible to more patients. The MICSI logo symbolizes a commitment to superior image quality, assuring patients of top-tier care at our MRI centers.
### Reduced Need for Repeat Scans
We get your imaging done right on the first visit. This high-quality imaging significantly decreases the need for follow-up scans, ensuring you get accurate results quickly and efficiently.
## Fewer MRI Images Required[[2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [3]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/doi.org/10.1097/rli.0000000000000979>)
### Increase Comfort
A MP-PCA enabled MRI scanner requires fewer images, minimizing the discomfort of extended sessions—especially beneficial for those with claustrophobia.
### Access to Care
MICSI’s goal is to transform MRI access, reducing wait times from months to days and easing the path to your medical imaging needs.
## Solutions & Use Cases
### Denoising
A Unique & Powerful Denoising Approach that Does Not Hallucinate[[1,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1053-8119\(16\)30394-9>) [2,](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/pubs.rsna.org/doi/full/10.1148/radiol.2020200822>) [6]](https://www.micsi.co/<https:/direct.mit.edu/imag/article/doi/10.1162/imag_a_00060/118691/Denoising-diffusion-MRI-Considerations-and>)
[Learn More](https://www.micsi.co/</denoising>)
### Brain
Denoising Diffusion and Functional MRI for Neuroimaging
[Learn More](https://www.micsi.co/</brain>)
### Prostate
Research OnlyDenoising Diffusion MRI for Prostate Imaging
[Learn More](https://www.micsi.co/</prostate>)

### Company Overview: MICSI

Founded in 2018, MICSI (Microstructure Imaging Inc.) operates out of New York and is a part of Y Combinator's Batch S23. With a small yet focused team of two, the company is on a mission to revolutionize magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) by introducing advanced AI software that significantly enhances the quality of MRI scans while drastically reducing their duration.

### Mission and Achievements

The primary goal of MICSI is to provide higher resolution MRIs with faster scan times. Their innovative software doubles the resolution of images and halves the scan time, resulting in substantial benefits for both imaging centers and patients. The potential to save lives is a central tenet of their mission, as the improved efficiency can lead to quicker diagnoses and treatments. Financially, facilities using MICSI's technology could see an uptick of up to $2 million per MRI scanner annually.

The company’s flagship product, MICSI-RMT, is FDA-approved and utilizes a unique MP-PCA denoising algorithm. This method effectively reduces noise levels in MRI images by four times, preserving the anatomical integrity that is crucial for accurate diagnosis. By allowing fewer images to be taken per session, MICSI improves patient comfort and accelerates throughput at imaging centers.

### Technology and Market Impact

MICSI targets the healthcare sectors, specifically focusing on creating a more accessible and cost-effective MRI experience. The software enhances both diffusion and functional MRI quality, and through rigorous clinical research, it has been validated for its efficacy. Their approach is not merely about better images; it's also about revolutionizing how MRIs are performed and utilized across the healthcare system.

Patients benefit from a reduced need for repeat scans, not only enhancing their experience but also streamlining processes within medical facilities. The technology is designed to make advanced imaging methods simpler and more widely available, bridging the gap between high-field MRIs and accessibility.

### Current Focus and Future Directions

Going forward, MICSI is set to expand its impact in different medical contexts, such as brain and prostate imaging. They are actively engaging in partnerships and seeking opportunities to present their solution at industry events, recently being recognized as a semi-finalist for the best new radiology software by AuntMinnie.com.

In summary, MICSI stands at the forefront of a vital transformation in medical imaging. By marrying advanced computer vision technology with critical healthcare needs, they've positioned themselves as a key player in making MRIs not only better but also significantly more efficient—a true game-changer in the field of healthcare imaging.

For more information, check out their website [here](https://www.micsi.co/).
